Package sketchy.ast

Class Node<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sketchy.ast.Node<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of value evaluated from this node, which could be Void if the node should not return any value, e.g., a statement.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Exp, OpNode, Stmt
    public abstract class Node<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Visitable
    Abstract class for all nodes.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public final T eval()
        Fake, never be executed.

      • eval

        public final T eval​(int holeId)
        Before we really evaluate, we need to check if we have seen this hole (only an AST node as hole will have eval() invoked) in the current run. 1) If we did see this hole before, we just get the stored ast for this hole from cache and evaluate it. 2) Otherwise we still get the stored ast from cache, but we then have to explore the next status of the ast before evaluating.

      • staticEval

        public final void staticEval​(int holedId)
        Static "evaluation". Just step randomly and save string representation of the ast node.

      • itr

        public final Itr itr()
        Return the iterator.

      • setItr

        Set the iterator.

      • stepRand

        public abstract void stepRand()
        Step to next random choice;

      • hasChoice

        public final boolean hasChoice()
        Returns if the exp has choices.

      • hasRandChoice

        public abstract boolean hasRandChoice()
        Returns if the exp has choice under random search strategy.

      • evaluate

        protected abstract T evaluate()

      • getJavaStr

        public final java.lang.String getJavaStr()
        Return the string representation of this ast node.
